title: Chain mail
data:
{{version031}} {{armour |name = Chain mail |cost = ? |weight = 40.0 |AC = 8 |EV = 14 |maxenc = +8 |size = Small, medium |GDR = 34% }} {{flavour|A suit made entirely out of tiny metal rings. Offering strong protection against weapons, claws and carnassials, chain mail hinders quick and stealthy movement.}} '''Chain mail''' is one of the heavier normal [[armour]]s you can acquire, providing substantial defense but at a heavy cost to evasion. It is one of two armours able to get the [[ponderousness]] ego. ==Desirability== Chain mail can be a decent option for heavy melee brutes - at least in the early game. Early on, chain mail can provide more overall defense than a [[plate armour]], and it's more common than plate. But as you gain more strength and/or [[Armour skill]], the plate armour will likely come out ahead. [[Dodge]]rs and casters will likely find this armour too [[Encumbrance rating|heavy]] to bother with. In general, it's not worth wearing in the long run, unless you get an awesome randart. ==History== *Prior to [[0.30]], chain mail had an encumbrance rating of 15. It also was unable to have the ponderousness ego. *Prior to [[0.13]], chain mail had 7 base AC. *Prior to [[0.10]], it had 6 base AC. The increases in AC have been due to the removal of [[banded mail]], and later, of [[splint mail]]. {| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:auto; padding:0; text-align: center" ! || Image |- | '''Mundane''' || [[Image:Chain mail1.png]] |- | '''Magical''' || [[Image:Chain mail2.png]] |- | '''Artifact''' || [[Image:Chain mail3.png]] |- ! || [[Unrandart]] chain mail |- | '''[[Lear's hauberk]]''' || [[Image:Lear's hauberk.png]] |} {{armours}}
